security_audit.summary: Low-risk skill that executes gh CLI for GitHub authentication and makes API calls to github.com. All capabilities are legitimate and necessary for the stated purpose. Code is clean with no obfuscation or suspicious patterns.

content.user_title: View and manage GitHub Issues and PRs
content.value_statement: Viewing GitHub Issues and PRs requires multiple CLI commands. This skill provides unified commands to view, create, and update Issues and PRs following team standards.
actual_capabilities: View GitHub PR details with optional diff, comments, reviews, and stats
Create GitHub Issues non-interactively using team standards
Create GitHub PRs with semantic title and standardized description
Update Issue and PR titles or descriptions
Export PR information as structured YAML output
Check GitHub API rate limit status
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Only supports github.com domain PRs and Issues
Does not create or modify PR review comments
Rate limits apply based on GitHub API tier

use_cases.title: Quick PR code review
use_cases.description: Pull PR details with diff in one command to review changes without opening browser

use_cases.title: Standardized PR descriptions
use_cases.description: Generate consistent PR descriptions following team conventions with semantic prefixes

use_cases.title: Issue tracking workflow
use_cases.description: Create and update Issues programmatically in CI/CD pipelines

prompt_templates.title: View PR details
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to see a pull request
prompt_templates.prompt: View this GitHub PR: https://github.com/OWNER/REPO/pull/123 with diff, stats, and all comments

prompt_templates.title: Create Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub Issue titled 'feat: add user authentication' with body describing the feature requirement

prompt_templates.title: Create PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR from branch 'feature/new-login' to main with semantic title 'feat(auth): implement OAuth2 login' and description including summary, key changes, and testing instructions

prompt_templates.title: Update PR title
prompt_templates.prompt: Update PR title to 'fix: resolve memory leak in connection pool' after reviewing the current title

output_examples.input: View PR https://github.com/owner/repo/pull/456 with diff, stats, and comments
output: âœ“ PR #456: feat: add user dashboard

best_practices: Always use --body-file for multi-line descriptions to avoid shell escaping issues
Include the PR URL as a separate line after successful creation
Review current content before updating any Issue or PR
anti_patterns: Using interactive editors for Issue or PR creation in automated workflows
Skipping the review step before updating titles or descriptions
Making multiple gh API calls when one script execution can gather all needed data

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code CLI environments.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: GitHub API limits vary by plan. Free tier: 60 requests/hour. Authenticated: 5,000/hour.

faq.question: How does authentication work?
faq.answer: The skill uses 'gh auth token' to retrieve your GitHub CLI authentication token automatically.

faq.question: Is my GitHub token stored or logged?
faq.answer: No. Tokens are used only for API requests and never written to logs or disk.

faq.question: Why does the script fail with 'gh command not found'?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI must be installed separately. Install via 'brew install gh' or from github.com/cli

faq.question: How does this differ from GitHub Copilot?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on PR/Issue operations via CLI, while Copilot provides code suggestions.
